results.title: Unwind the urban
results.brief_description:
Set to traditional Japanese music, this black and white computer animation depicts a natural world of beauty and tradition.
Music by Tadano Noriko - “Apple for one’s eye”

results.title: To save oneself
results.brief_description:
Hand-drawn animated piece about child abuse. Simplistic but confronting.
Music by Justin R. Durban.

results.title: Style 'n progress
results.brief_description:
Animated monster taggers from outer space invade the streets of Kuala Lumpur to brilliantly colour our environment.
Original music by D’Navigator, edited and arranged by Markus Kellow.

results.title: The Red dancer
results.brief_description: Dancing red flames multiply and morph into ever-changing shapes, reaching out across the screen to the rhythmic sounds of tribal music beating in the background.

results.title: The Orb
results.brief_description:
A 3D animated orb faces the pitfalls of a deadly industrial pinball track in this metaphorical interpretation of the creation of life.
Music by Markus Kellow.

results.title: Little blue planet
results.brief_description: A contemplative piece about the little blue planet we call earth. Portrays the chaotic pace of modern city life through a montage of stunning images and a pulsating music soundtrack, “Thunder downunder” composed and performed by Markus Kellow.

results.title: Il Fantasista
results.brief_description: Three steps every football player should know if they want to be il fantasista - skills, flamboyance and wealth and of course the no. 10. An amusing musical take on football heroes.

results.title: Hikikomori: alienation through technology
results.brief_description:
“In the year 2004, it was expected that 1 million young adults will withdraw from the Japanese society.” This interpretative performance piece explores Hikikomori through representational images - a sculpture of animation and art.
Performers: Yee Wei, Lester King. No dialogue, music soundtrack only.
